Tucson smiles back to Talon as he looks to Straight Shot who is more than t=
hrilled to be working with Kup.  She still waits to see what weapon he want=
s her to transform into.

"Umm Kup, ya forgot ta mention which weapon you p=
reffer, cross bow or traditional bow?  Any of them will do."

Tucson couldn=
't help but put an arm around Talon, and give her a gentile embrace.

" And=
 as for you Talon, we will need some heavy hitters to finish the job. I hav=
e full trust in you as a warrior and I'd like you to join me in bringing up=
 the rear.  Rodimus, you will go before me, and if anything happens to you,=
 I will back you up."

Night Shift then turns to Perceptor.

" Okay Percept=
or, looks like you'n I are gon' it tagether.  No worries, I've done plenty =
of silent infiltrations, and ben' a ninjabot, I know when ta make myself sc=
arce."

Rat Trap now approaches Windlord.

"If ya want, we could team up.  =
That way you're not gon' it alone."

Tucson nodds.

"Excellent idea, Rat Tr=
ap. In this case, it doesn't hurt everyone to be working with another comra=
de, due to the magnatude of this mission. It's far safer for everyone to te=
am up with someone."

Quickstride raises his hand.

"We forgot about Rodimu=
s, I think I better go with him.  Y'know, for extra fire arm support?"

Tuc=
son nodds.

"Yes, I agree.  Rodimus, I'm sending Quickstride with you.  His=
 skills on the battlefield will be much needed.  And Cheetor, feel free to =
fall back on anyone you wish.  The more we work with each other, the strong=
er we will be.   And as for Cyclonus, that is the only exception my friends=
.  I do not wish to lose any of you to his wrath, therefore, I wish to deal=
 with him myself."

Rat Trap gasps.

"But, but, that's almost like suicide!=
  Ya heard Rodimus!  Ya can't do that!"

Tucson grins.

"Not if I listen to=
 the power of the Matrix.  It will guide me, as it has guided Optimus Prime=
.  I will not stray from its wisdom, and nor shall I ignore any unforseen d=
anger."

Rat Trap quickly leaps up onto Tucson's leg and embraces him in ra=
t form.

" Please, I almost lost ya once, I don't wanna lose ya again."

Tu=
cson could understand where Rat Trap was comming from, and instead of brush=
ing him off, which he would never do, he returns the embrace.

" You won't,=
 I promise you.  All I ask in return is that you continue the faith.  For t=
hat is power that not even Cyclonus has, and it's that power which will see=
 all of us through, even myself."

With a tear, Rat Trap nodds.

"You got i=
t Wheels, I'll never lose faith, ever."

Tucson then turns to Lord Elder.

=
" As with Talon, I'd like you to join me as well, Lord Elder.  Hydras has d=
one you great wrong and I'd like you to be there to see the tables turn, pl=
us, the more help we have, the better off we are. Now, as Optimus would say=
, TRANSFORM AND ROLL OUT!"

> Rodimus looked over at Windlord, a look o=
f shared pain in his face.
> "There are several of us that he felt the stin=
g of Hydras' power."
> Rodimus said as he strightened. He looked around at =
the others, his
> optics flashing as he contained his own internal anger. "=
Hydras has
> long used this method of control to create his troops from the=
 ashes
> of Maximal protoforms." His voice deep and controlled. "He must be=

> stopped."
> 
> Walking more or less to the middle of the room he turned =
to face the
> others, "There is little doubt that Hydras has spent at least=
 some of
> this time shoring up his base against the same methods that we u=
sed to
> enter before." Rodimus frowned, "and Cyclonus is a force to be
> r=
eckoned with as well."
> 
> Turning his head to look at Tuscon Rodimus cont=
inued, "Like you he has
> felt the power of the Matrix and has been forever=
 changed by it, but
> in his case it has been corrupted, a dark twisted ver=
sion of it."
> Rodimus clenched his fist, "But do not mistake it for a mome=
nt that
> his wisdom and cunning are greater than they had been before - he=

> knows much more than he reveals."
> 
> Cheetor crossed his arms over his=
 chest, "Power or no power, we will
> blast him back to Cybertron!" he said=
, his voice exuding that
> exuberant confidence that was ever his trademark=
.
> 
> Rodimus smiled, "Good, we will need that spirit soon." He turned to
=
> look at the others, "But first we need a concrete plan of action, to
> be=
 sure that we all act together." He looked around, "Is anyone
> keeping wat=
ch on Hydras' base?"
